item.title: 沃伯格和伯克希尔合伙人同意以 30 亿美元收购 Triumph
item.description: 私募股权公司华平投资（Warburg Pincus）和伯克希尔合伙公司（Berkshire Partners）同意以约 30 亿美元（包括债务）的价格将飞机零部件和服务供应商凯旋集团公司（Triumph Group Inc.【原文：Private equity firms Warburg Pincus and Berkshire Partners agreed to take aircraft parts and services supplier Triumph Group Inc. private for about $3 billion, including debt.】

item.title: 欧盟检察官在印度钢铁欺诈案中锁定德国公司
item.description: 欧洲检察官突袭了一家德国公司的办公室，该公司涉嫌实施一项涉及印度钢铁进口的欺诈计划。【原文：European prosecutors have raided the offices of a German company suspected of running a fraud scheme involving Indian steel imports.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长西姆库斯认为 3 月后将有更多降息举措
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员吉迪米纳斯-西姆库斯（Gediminas Simkus）表示，欧洲中央银行很可能在下次会议后降低借贷成本。【原文：The European Central Bank is likely to lower borrowing costs beyond its next meeting, according to Governing Council member Gediminas Simkus.】

item.title: 特朗普对北美征收关税也将重创亚洲盟友
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普计划对墨西哥和加拿大征收的关税也对美国在亚洲的一些最亲密盟友造成了打击。【原文：Donald Trump’s planned tariffs on Mexico and Canada are also dealing a blow to some of the US’s closest allies in Asia.】

item.title: 南非工厂因莫桑比克贸易中断而情绪低落
item.description: 由于企业担心莫桑比克大选后的动乱对贸易的影响、最近的航空燃料短缺以及安赛乐米塔尔公司计划关闭其长材生产单位，南非 1 月份的工厂景气连续第三个月下滑。【原文：South Africa’s factory mood fell for the third straight month in January, as business worried about the impact of Mozambique’s post-election unrest on trade, recent jet fuel shortages and the planned closure of ArcelorMittal SA’s longs steel production units.】

item.title: 莱法森银行在俄罗斯的客户为普京的战争机器提供补给
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的文件，总部位于维也纳的莱费森国际银行股份公司（Raiffeisen Bank International AG）一直在从为弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）的军队供货的公司那里赚钱，因为俄罗斯军队在乌克兰咄咄逼人。【原文：Vienna-based Raiffeisen Bank International AG has been making money from firms supplying Vladimir Putin’s military, according to documents seen by Bloomberg, as the Russian army grinds forward in Ukraine.】

item.title: 卡齐米尔表示，欧洲央行需要在利率问题上保持谨慎和灵活性
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员彼得-卡齐米尔（Peter Kazimir）表示，欧洲中央银行可能会进一步降低借贷成本，但必须保持灵活和谨慎，因为现在宣布战胜通胀还为时过早。【原文：The European Central Bank will probably lower borrowing costs further, but must remain flexible and cautious as it’s too early to declare victory over inflation, according to Governing Council member Peter Kazimir.】

item.title: 欧洲汽车股下跌，大众、宝马、斯特兰蒂斯面临关税之痛
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的新关税承诺将削减这些公司在墨西哥工厂的销售额，大众汽车公司（Volkswagen AG）和施特兰蒂斯公司（Stellantis NV）领跌欧洲汽车股，创下 4 月份以来的最大盘中跌幅。【原文：Volkswagen AG and Stellantis NV led the steepest intraday decline in European auto shares since April as US President Donald Trump’s new tariffs promised to cut into sales from their factories in Mexico.】

item.title: 经济形势变化后三菱重新审视日本海上风电
item.description: 随着宏观经济的变化，包括日元贬值、利率上升和供应链紧张，三菱公司正在审查三个日本海上风电项目的业务计划。【原文：Mitsubishi Corp. is reviewing business plans for three Japanese offshore wind power projects following macroeconomic changes, including the depreciation of the yen, rising interest rates and tight supply chains.】

item.title: 尼日利亚力争到 2027 年将石油日产量提高到 270 万桶
item.description: 尼日利亚总统的一位顾问说，尼日利亚作为非洲最大的石油生产国，已经为自己设定了一个目标，即到2027年将原油和凝析油的日产量提高约五分之三，达到270万桶。【原文：Nigeria, Africa’s biggest oil producer, has set itself a target of boosting daily production by about three fifths to 2.7 million barrels of crude and condensate by 2027, an adviser to the country’s president said.】

item.title: 2024 年香港经济因消费和房地产问题而放缓
item.description: 2024 年，香港经济增长速度放缓，原因是消费停滞和房地产行业乏力，这凸显了亚洲金融之都在贸易战迫在眉睫的情况下面临的风险。【原文：Hong Kong’s economy grew at a slower pace in 2024 as stagnant consumption and a lackluster property sector weighed on activity, highlighting the risks ahead for Asia’s financial capital amid a looming trade war.】

item.title: 欧洲央行维勒鲁瓦称美国关税令人担忧并引发不确定性
item.description: 法国央行行长弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对加拿大和墨西哥征收关税 "令人担忧"，加剧了欧洲经济的不确定性。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s tariffs on Canada and Mexico are “worrying” and heighten economic uncertainty for Europe, Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.】

item.title: 欧盟勉强实现天然气储存目标，重新储存的挑战迫在眉睫
item.description: 欧洲勉强达到了 2 月份的天然气库存目标，一些国家没有达到阈值，因为供应担忧挥之不去。【原文：Europe barely met its February target for natural gas inventories, with some nations missing their thresholds as supply concerns linger.】

item.title: Ares 基金第一年就从富人手中募集到 22 亿欧元资金
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的一份声明，Ares Management Corp. 已为其开放式欧洲直接借贷基金筹集了超过 22 亿欧元（22.5 亿美元）的资金，主要来自富裕的个人。【原文：Ares Management Corp. has raised over €2.2 billion ($2.25 billion) primarily from wealthy individuals for its open-ended European direct lending fund, according to a statement seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 特朗普重启贸易战让谢因成为焦点
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对中国和其他国家征收的关税震撼了市场，给寻求上市的中国企业蒙上了一层阴影。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s tariffs on China and other countries are rocking markets and casting a pall over Chinese firms seeking to go public.】

item.title: 土耳其上月通胀率降至 42% 低于预期
item.description: 年初，土耳其的年度通胀率略低于预期，而月度物价增长速度也超过了预期。【原文：Turkey’s annual inflation eased slightly less than expected at the start of the year, while monthly price-growth also accelerated more than forecast.】

item.title: 特朗普加征关税后，美国炼油商将目光投向拉美和伊拉克
item.description: 据交易商称，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发出关税警告后，美国炼油商将把目光投向拉丁美洲和中东，以取代突然变得更加昂贵的加拿大和墨西哥原油。【原文：US oil refiners will look to Latin America and the Middle East to replace suddenly more expensive Canadian and Mexican crudes following President Donald Trump’s tariff salvo, according to traders.】

item.title: 巴西莫雷拉-萨莱斯家族可能竞购法国维拉利亚公司
item.description: 巴西亿万富翁莫雷拉-萨莱斯（Moreira Salles）家族表示，它正在探索对 Verallia SA 的潜在收购要约，对这家法国包装公司的估值约为 36 亿欧元（37 亿美元）。【原文：Brazil’s billionaire Moreira Salles family said it’s exploring a potential offer for Verallia SA that would value the French packaging company at about €3.6 billion ($3.7 billion).】

item.title: 受特朗普关税威胁影响，美国石油涨幅超过全球基准油价
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布将限制美国最大的两个外国原油供应国的原油供应后，美国石油基准指数的涨幅超过了全球指数。【原文：The American oil benchmark outpaced gains in the global marker after President Donald Trump announced tariffs that will limit supplies from the US’s two biggest foreign suppliers of crude.】

item.title: 科塔克高管表示，印度减税将促进储蓄和消费
item.description: 科塔克-马恒达银行（Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd.）副总经理 Shanti Ekambaram 认为，印度预算案中的税收调整后，人们手中多出的现金将对经济产生 "乘数效应"，促进消费、储蓄和投资。【原文：The extra cash in the hands of people following the tax tweaks in India’s budget will have a “multiplier effect on the economy” and boost consumption, savings and investments according to Shanti Ekambaram, deputy managing director at Kotak Mahindra Bank Ltd.】
